results.title: Game Masters: Blizzard Entertainment interview
results.brief_description:
Blizzard Entertainment is a world leading developer and publisher renowned for creating some of the industry’s most critically acclaimed games. Blizzard’s first success was in 1994 with ‘Warcraft: Orcs and Humans’, a game that laid the foundations for the burgeoning real-time strategy genre, introducing gameplay features that would become standards. In 1996 the company released the action-role-playing-game ‘Diablo’. With a track record that includes thirteen number one games and multiple Game of the Year awards, Blizzard Entertainment has gone on to establish one of the largest online followings of any game company worldwide.

The company is best known for the subscription-based massively multiplayer online role-playing games ‘World of Warcraft’ (2004), and ‘StarCraft’ (1998) series. NB: Interviewer is neither seen nor heard onscreen.

results.title: Ready and able
results.brief_description: Members of the CFA provide practical advice on how to prepare for and survive a major catastrophe like a bushfire or a flood. These interviews were conducted in light of the tragic Black Saturday bushfires in February 2009.
results.description: Members of the CFA provide practical advice on how to prepare for and survive a major catastrophe like a bushfire or a flood. These interviews were conducted in light of the tragic Black Saturday bushfires in February 2009.

group.title: Living with disaster: stories and experiences from disasters

group_siblings.title: When a fire comes to you

results.title: When a fire comes to you
results.brief_description: When the threat of fire hit Lydia Romari’s family, they adopted their fire plan and stayed safe. Unfortunately, it doesn’t erase the frustration, anxiety and horror of the Black Saturday bushfires that devestated much of the Yarra Ranges region in Victoria in 2009.

results.title: Home again
results.brief_description: Kat Hay provides her account of the Newcastle Floods of 2007, from the realisation that it was not an ordinary day to the feelings associated with returning home after everything was destroyed.

results.title: When the flood comes
results.brief_description: The Newcastle floods of 2007 have caused Djibril Ly to reflect on growing up in Mauritania in West Africa. He recalls the devestation of flooding and how this has helped him to prepare for similar events in Australia.

results.title: A Plan to be safe
results.brief_description: Carla Zekas and her family were spending a hot Summer’s day by the river when the dark clouds first emerged. At that moment, the plan changed from staying cool to being safe.

results.title: A Story to inspire
results.creator_credit: Tanika Deemal-Parker, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Tanika Deemal-Parker has been singing all her life. She has been encouraged by her mum to take her singing further and, when doubts set in, it was her mum that helped her through with some words of wisdom.

results.title: Step by step
results.creator_credit: Sam Kluk, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Sam Kluk loved his beautiful town of Kuranda in Northern Queensland. Unfortunately, there was another side to the quiet town and Kluk was determined to take every opportunity to escape it.

results.title: My beach
results.creator_credit: Richard Sagigi, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Life, for Richard Sagigi, was never always easy. Times at school when he was getting into trouble forced him to move to another school. But he knows that he can reconnect with himself on the beach where his family live, digging for turtle eggs, learning about animal conservation and meeting people from different cultures.

results.title: Life in the Kimberleys
results.creator_credit: Rhys Bedford, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Rhys Bedford has a lot of doors open to him, now that he is the recipient of a scholarship at Hale College in Western Australia. But it is when he returns to his family in Kununurra that Bedford gets to explore and reconnect with his country and heritage.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rhys Bedford, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
